title: Representations - Using the First Derivative Test

content.question: If <math alttext="f prime of x equals, 1 plus 2 x, minus x cubed, minus the square root of x to the fourth power, plus 1, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>f</mi><mo>′</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><msqrt><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>4</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></msqrt></math>, then <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> has a local minimum at <math alttext="x equals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo></mrow></math>

topic.text: 5.4: Using the First Derivative Test to Determine Relative (Local) Extrema

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
